page.title: 10TRANSPORT.
page.content: Public transport consists of two buses each week on market days,one to Braintree on Wednesdays the other to Haverhill on Fridays. Because of this scarcity most households have one car and many have two, particularly those where the husbands work far away from the village. Several youths have motor bikes and most of the children have bicycles which are well used, especially at weekends and during school holidays. There is a school bus during term time which picks the children up at various points in the village and outlying district. Horses are used by a handful of people but are more for leisure than transport.
